text:
I want to add image in hubdb image column using fetch image url api - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/form-integrations/v1/uploaded-files/signed-url-redirect>
But, image is not getting displayed in Hubdb but is displayed on page view.

But we are login in backend then it won't get dispalyed on frontrend as well.

Hi all - non-developer here trying to help developers find an elegant solution to a need. Is it possible to _send_ information about a contact following a form submission to another system, in JSON format, using an app/webhook approach? If so, I just need to point the team in the right direction. Any help greatly appreciated.
If the form manipulates the contact, the webhook recieves all the data that is attached to the user.
Thanks - would this simply apply to all contacts upon any change, or can a specific form be used to control the sending of data?
The work flow decides which form is send to the webhook.
ahh - that's an enterprise feature right? If that is not available, can it be done in code?
I don't know a way to check form submissions via the API. The only way I know is workflows
Hi <@UCBLGCB4L> , this should be possible, I don't have an example set up to test this. But passing the pageId is exactly like passing the pageName and pageUri in the context. See below example:
The fact that it is a popup form should not affect this. LMK if you have any further questions or hit any errors.
Awesome! thanks <@UFBDBKQ1H> :slightly_smiling_face:

<@UDDJG2VFG> thanks that's what I'm trying to figure out; the best way to create a "deal queue" and edit their execution date if needed. The version of my app without deal queue is really straight forward, but I never created a "job queue" or somehting like that in node.js.. do you know some packages or resources that can help me? Here's the flow chart of my app. If you have any hint, you're welcome.
Hey <@UFBDBKQ1H> so quick question, will this register page views to the api form regardless if the form was submitted or not?
<@UM5JQ5EUE> you can get submissions for a form
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/get-submissions-for-a-form>
I imagine you can setup webhook subscriptions for Contact Created, Contact deleted and contact property change.

Let's debate: I think transactionnal email add-on is too expensive. Accroding to me it prevents a good user/developer adoption because it is way cheaper to start an app with email services like mailgun or sendgrid and after that no one wants to make the move to another solution. It is really hard to make a developer team to move to another solution, so when we talk of a solution that can be X time more expensive it's almost impossible. What do you think?

I’ve considered building a mechanism to use Mailgun for transactional emails within workflows on more than one occasion because the transactional email add-on (plus dedicated IP requirement) is too expensive
I’ve also wondered if it’s priced that high to reduce the risk of people using transactional emails for spamming
your mailgun workaround would use webhook triggers I supposed?
Yep
interesting

Also possibly using timeline events to pipe delivery/open/click information back in to HubSpot… It wouldn’t be as nicely integrated with the rest of HubSpot as native emails, obviously, but I’m not as concerned about open/click reporting for transactional emails as I would be for true campaign emails
gotcha
hi all - can anyone help me regarding google map routes api to integrate on HubSpot cms using custom module?
